title: Album Page, "Profile of Molding and Cornice with View of Modillion in Elevation and Profile", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on off-white wove paper with deckled edges tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Watermark: Double inscribed circle containing an anchor, each terminal ending in an arrow.
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right of sheet: 122; lower right corner: 115; left center of sheet: Main cornice / frieze.
dimensions: Sheet: 29.6 x 20.5 cm (11 5/8 x 8 1/16 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet missing upper right corner and with section of bottom left corner of sheet cut out.  The upper half of the sheet contains two sketches of molding profiles, while the lower half of the sheet contains a modillion with leaf ornament that is seen in elevation and again seen but in an elevation as attached to a wall surface. The molding profile of the wall surface has been articulated.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Profile of Molding and Cornice with View of Modillion in Elevation and Profile", late 19th century.Graphite on off-white wove paper with deckled edges tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-291.
